reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Scaling up the KOCP community-based Elephant Conservation Unit to better understand elephant ecology in man-made landscapes and mitigate raising conflicts with people.

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The purpose of this project is to expand the range of an existing community-based Elephant Conservation Unit (ECU) to reach communities recently experiencing human-elephant conflict (HEC) as well as collect Asian elephant behavioral and socioecological data in agricultural landscapes in Sabah, Malaysia. Four additional members will be added to the ECU and their range will be increased to cover additional districts. Project activities include: 1) direct observations of Asian elephant herds within agricultural landscapes (especially oil palm), habitat assessments, and assessments of elephant-related damages; 2) identification and training of community members in HEC-affected villages; 3) surveys of local communities, and education and awareness events; 4) law enforcement patrols via an Honorary Wildlife Warden Program; and 5) contributing to the development of policy documents and strategies to manage Asian elephants and their ranges in Sabah. This project will contribute to the conservation of wild Asian elephant populations in Sabah by increasing knowledge of elephant ecology outside of protected areas, reducing HEC levels in areas with relatively new HEC activity, and contributing to efforts to better manage Sabah’s wild elephants by informing policy and land-use decision-making by policymakers..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. foreign assistance in Malaysia promotes peace and security by strengthening cooperation on law enforcement, nonproliferation, counterterrorism, rule of law, and expanding military ties. Assistance will further Malaysia's role as a reliable partner in maintaining regional stability, fighting terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction (WMD), and strengthening key regional and global institutions that will contribute to the America's security. Counterterrorism (CT) assistance builds capacity within Malaysian law enforcement and judicial organizations; supports activities to improve Malaysia's border security; and strengthens networks between civil society, the government, and the private sector to counter violent extremism (CVE). Counter-proliferation assistance strengthens Malaysia's ability to prevent transshipments of controlled munitions and dual-use commodities. Military assistance and training builds critical capabilities among Malaysia's armed forces, allowing it to take on an expanded international role, including peacekeeping and stabilization operations and promotes a positive and lasting transformation of the U.S.-Malaysian relationship to further shared goals.
